column1: Kata Robata////Now for the quirks. I'm not one for perfuming a restaurant up since smells can overwhelm the tastes of the fish
column2: but there was a decidedly less-than-fresh odor I noticed when we walked in. Maybe some nighttime cleaning of the seating surfaces with nice-smelling detergents and/or some deodorizing of the sushi prep area would help. Also
column3: my friend noted that they seemed a little TOO overeager to clear our plates
column6: we just wanted people buzzing around less frequently so we could have a less interrupted conversation. She actually had a plate cleared while the bite of food was still on her chopsticks. A little bit more ambience might help. A few tweaks
column7: and this place could become one of my favorites
column8: if it overcomes the few speed bumps.
